sen.j: 新京極通（しんきょうごくどおり）は京都市の南北の通りの一つ。
sen.e: The Shinkyogoku-dori Street is one of north-south running streets of Kyoto City.
The Shinkyogoku-dori Street is a street running north-south in Kyoto City.
The Shinkyogoku-dori Street is a street running north-south in Kyoto City.

sen.j: 三条通から四条通までの比較的短い通りである。
sen.e: It is relatively short, running from the Sanjo-dori Street to the Shijo-dori Street.
It is relatively short, running from Sanjo-dori Street to Shijo-dori Street.
It is relatively short, running from Sanjo-dori Street to Shijo-dori Street.

sen.j: 1872年に京都府参事槇村正直によって作られた比較的新しい通りである。
sen.e: It is a relatively new street built in 1872 by Masanao MAKIMURA, then Kyoto Prefectural Councilor.
It is a relatively new street built in 1872 by Masanao MAKIMURA, then Kyoto Prefectural Councilor.
It is a relatively new street built in 1872 by Masanao MAKIMURA, then Kyoto Prefectural Councilor.

sen.j: 一つ隣の寺町通（寺町京極）に集まる寺院の境内が、縁日の舞台として利用されるようになり、人が多く集まったため、各寺院の境内を整理し、寺町通のすぐ東側に新しく道路を造ったのが新京極通のはじまりである。
sen.e: The Shinkyogoku-dori Street was built immediately east of theTeramachi-dori Street by rearranging the precincts of the shrines and temples that are gathered on theTeramachi-dori Street (Teramachi-Kyogoku) because hoppings held in the precincts became popular and attracted many visitors.
sen.cmt: 縁日 英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: Shinkyogoku-dori Street was built immediately east of Teramachi-dori Street by rearranging the precincts of the shrines and temples gathered on Teramachi-dori Street (Teramachi-Kyogoku) because hoppings held in the precincts became popular and attracted many visitors.

Shinkyogoku-dori Street was built immediately east of Teramachi-dori Street by rearranging the precincts of the shrines and temples gathered on Teramachi-dori Street (Teramachi-Kyogoku) because fairs held in the precincts became popular and attracted many visitors.

sen.j: 明治の中頃には見世物小屋や芝居小屋が建ち並び、現在の繁華街の原型ができた。
sen.e: In the mid-Meiji era, the street was lined with show tents and playhouses, which was the original of today's amusement center.
sen.cmt: 見世物小屋 英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: In the mid-Meiji era, the street was lined with show tents and playhouses, which was the progeniator of today's amusement center.
In the mid-Meiji period, the street was lined with show tents and playhouses, which was the progenitor of today's amusement center.

sen.j: かつては、京都方面の修学旅行のコースに取り入れられるようになったため、修学旅行の中高生の行き来の絶えない所となり、老舗もあり地元の者も訪れる隣の寺町京極に比べて、新京極は那覇市の国際通りなどと同様の観光客向けの通りとなり、地元の者が利用することはほとんどなかった。
sen.e: Once, unlike Teramachi-Kyogoku with old-established shops visited by local people, the Shinkyogoku-dori Street, which was included in a school trip course for junior and high school students, was so full of such students that local people rarely visit this street; it was a tourist-oriented street just like the Kokusai-dori Street in Naha City.
sen.cmt: 修学旅行 英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: Once, unlike Teramachi-Kyogoku which had old-established shops visited by local people, Shinkyogoku-dori Street, which was included in a school trip course for junior and high school students, was so full of students that local people came to rarely visit this street; it was a tourist-oriented street just like Kokusai-dori Street in Naha City.

Once, unlike Teramachi-Kyogoku which had old-established shops visited by local people, Shinkyogoku-dori Street, which was included in a school trip course for junior and high school students, was so full of students that local people came to rarely visit this street; it was a tourist-oriented street just like Kokusai-dori Street in Naha City.

sen.j: しかし近年では、観光客向けの土産物店の他、飲食店、ファッション洋品店が混在し、若年層向けの店舗が目立つようになった。
sen.e: Recently, however, the street have shown a mixture of restaurants and boutiques in addition to souvenior shops for tourists, with the number of shops for young people increasing..
Recently, however, the street have shown a mixture of restaurants and boutiques in addition to souvenior shops for tourists, with shops for young people increasing.
Recently, however, the street have shown a mixture of restaurants and boutiques in addition to souvenir shops for tourists, with shops for young people increasing.

sen.j: また、松竹座に代表される老舗の映画館が、ようやく、シネコンへの改装を果たした。
sen.e: Also Shochiku-za Theater, a typical old-established movie theater, has been finally rebuilt into a cinema complex. The district along the street is changing to meet new needs.
Also Shochiku-za Theater, a typical old movie theater, has been finally rebuilt into a cinema complex. The district along the street is changing to meet new needs.
Also Shochiku-za Theater, a typical old movie theater, has been finally rebuilt into a cinema complex.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: 新しいニーズに合った街へと変貌しつつある。
sen.e: The district along the street is changing to meet new needs.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: 三条通から四条通までが路上喫煙等禁止区域である。
sen.e: The street between the Sanjo-dori Street and the Shijo-dori Street is a Public Nonsmoking Area.
The street between the Sanjo-dori Street and the Shijo-dori Street is a Public Nonsmoking Area.
The street between the Sanjo-dori Street and the Shijo-dori Street is a Public Nonsmoking Area.

tit.j: 平安京の京極と西京極

sen.j: 京極は文字通り京の端を意味し、平安京においては、東端に東京極大路、西端に西京極大路が配された。
sen.e: Kyogoku literally means the edge of Kyo (capital) and the Higasikyogoku-oji Street was laid out along the eastern edge and the Nishikyogoku-oji Street was placed along the western edge in Heiankyo.
Kyogoku literally means the edge of Kyo (capital) and Higasikyogoku-oji Street was laid out along the eastern edge and Nishikyogoku-oji Street was placed along the western edge in Heiankyo.
Kyogoku literally means the edge of Kyo (capital) and Higasikyogoku-oji Street was laid out along the eastern edge and Nishikyogoku-oji Street was placed along the western edge in Heiankyo.

sen.j: 寺町通（寺町京極）はこの東京極大路にあたる。
sen.e: The Teramachi-dori Street corresponds to the Higasikyogoku-oji Street.
The Teramachi-dori Street corresponds to Higasikyogoku-oji Street.
The Teramachi-dori Street (Teramachi Kyogoku) corresponds to Higasikyogoku-oji Street.

sen.j: 西京極大路は現在の葛野大路通の西側と推定されている。
sen.e: The Nishikyogoku-oji Street is considered to have lain to the west of today's Kadonoji-dori Street.
The Nishikyogoku-oji Street is considered to have lain to the west of today's Kadonoji-dori Street.
The Nishikyogoku-oji Street is considered to have lain to the west of today's Kadonooji-dori Street.

sen.j: 西京極大路と阪急京都線の交わるところに西京極駅が位置し、この周囲の概ね五条通-八条通、桂川-西高瀬川の範囲が西京極である。
sen.e: Nishikyogoku Station is located at the intersection between the Nishikyogoku-oji Street and Hankyu Kyoto Line, and around the station is NishiKyogoku, the area surrounded by the Gojo-dori Street, the Hachijo-dori Street, the Katsura River, and the Nishitakase-gawa River.

Nishikyogoku Station is located at the intersection between Nishikyogoku-oji Street and Hankyu Kyoto Line, and around the station is NishiKyogoku, the area surrounded by Gojo-dori Street, Hachijo-dori Street, Katsura River, and Nishitakase-gawa River.

Nishikyogoku Station is located at the intersection between Nishikyogoku-oji Street and Hankyu Kyoto Line, and around the station is Nishi Kyogoku, the area surrounded by Gojo-dori Street, Hachijo-dori Street, Katsura River, and Nishitakase-gawa River.

sen.j: 西京極には西京極総合運動公園陸上競技場兼球技場などがある。
sen.e: Athletics and ball game ground, Nishikyogoku Sogo Undo Park is in Nishikyogoku.
The athletics facility and ball game ground, Nishikyogoku Sogo Undo Park is in Nishikyogoku.
The athletics facility and ball game ground, Nishikyogoku Sogo Undo Park is in Nishikyogoku.

sen.j: 新京極通の賑わいにちなんだ「○○京極」と呼ばれる商店街が存在する。
sen.e: Some shopping streets have their names ending with Kyogoku, which was given in association with the lively Shinkyogoku-dori Street.
Some shopping streets have their names ending with Kyogoku, which was given in association with the lively Shinkyogoku-dori Street.
Some shopping streets have their names ending with Kyogoku, which was given in association with the lively Shinkyogoku-dori Street.

sen.j: 全国の都市における○○銀座の京都版といえるだろう。
sen.e: This naming is unique in Kyoto and equivalent to the way of giving the name Ginza to shopping streets found in cities across the country.
This naming is unique in Kyoto and equivalent to the way the name Ginza is given to shopping streets found in cities across the country.
